explanation: Agent A is correct. metal_add_page_size() uses strncpy(_metal.page_sizes[index].path, path, PATH_MAX) where the destination is char path[PATH_MAX]. When strlen(path) >= PATH_MAX, strncpy will copy PATH_MAX bytes and will not NUL-terminate the destination. Any later use that expects a NUL-terminated C string (for example a %s conversion or other APIs that read until '\0') can then read past the end of the array and cause an out-of-bounds access. That sequence (unsafe use of strncpy producing a non-terminated buffer -> later %s reading past the buffer) is precisely the kind of situation MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 prohibits. Note: the metal_log call shown in metal_add_page_size logs the original path parameter (which is assumed NUL-terminated), but the stored copy in _metal.page_sizes[].path is left non-terminated by strncpy and therefore poses a violation risk if it is later used as a C string. The report is therefore correct.
